alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 2:53PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Heavy rains in the Kroto Creek and Moose Creek Basins have cause rapid rises and lowland flooding across the area. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Kroto Creek and Moose Creek covering the Oilwell Road area. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roadways, in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 957 AM AKDT, flooding was reported on Oilwell Road at MP 6.2. Observer and river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the Moose Creek and Kroto Creek drainages. This will cause minor flooding from overflow of poor drainage areas, especially near Kroto Creek and Moose Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
